column4: Has anyone seen this problem while trying to dosfsck a partition? http://pastebin.ca/961299
lol, thats a funny error
yeah an fdisk says  W95 FAT32
so what gives?
maybe you could reinstall
er, something like sudo apt-get install --reinstall apache2
lol, well, I'm glad it helped a bit
nope didn't work
which conf file are you missing?
apache.conf and httpd.conf
apache2.conf
sudo apt-get install --reinstall apache2.2-common
awesome, that recreate all except the apache2.conf
jigga wha?  that was supposed to work FOR apache2.conf
weird huh?
aint nothin better than a clean install to fix problems like these
any idea how I can recreate apache2.conf file?? there has to be a way? I did wirte it up from scratch the first time.
well, I think its in the deb that I had you reinstall
I just checked, its in the .deb file.  You can use archive manager, and just grab it
cooll
Is it the SRC deb i'm looking for?
no, the one you installed from, that apache2-common thing
